surrounding

Class Field

  • java.lang.Object
    • surrounding.Field

  • public class Field
extends java.lang.Object
    The Field class holds the node network. It is its responsibility to make sure each node is updated, and made ready for the next iteration, each iteration. It is the Field class which initially determines which nodes are supposed to create messages and when.

    The class allows for some multi-threading. See each specific method for further details.
    Since:
    2016-05-19
    Version:
    1.0
    Author:
    Alexander Beliaev, Nils Sundberg

      Creates a Field object with the amount of updates the simulation hold, the event chance range (the chance it then calculated by 1/the input value), the agent chance range, the interval between request message creations, and the number of request nodes.

    • Constructor Detail

      • Field

        public Field(int updateLimit,
             int eventChanceRange,
             int agentChanceRange,
             int requestIntervalRange,
             int numberOfRequestNodes)
      throws java.lang.IllegalArgumentException

        Creates a Field object with the amount of updates the simulation hold, the event chance range (the chance it then calculated by 1/the input value), the agent chance range, the interval between request message creations, and the number of request nodes. The following are legal parameter values:

        • updateLimit: above 0
        • requestIntervalRange: above 0
        • eventChanceRange
          1. -1, to disable events and agents
          2. above 0 to enable event and specify value
        • agentChanceRange
          1. -1, to disable agents
          2. above 0 to enable agents and specify value
        • numberOfRequestNodes
          1. 0, to disable requests
          2. above 0 to enable requests and specify value

        Parameters:
        updateLimit - the amount of updates the simulation should run.
        eventChanceRange - the request chance range.
        agentChanceRange - the agent chance range.
        requestIntervalRange - the number of updates between request message creations.
        numberOfRequestNodes - number of request nodes.
        Throws:
        java.lang.IllegalArgumentException - if either of the given arguments don't follow the above mentioned rules.
        See Also:
        Message, Node

    • Method Detail

      • update

        public void update()

        Updates all nodes in the node network by calling all of their subsequent update methods. This method does this indiscriminately, meaning that it is up to each individual node to decide if it should update or not. This method also decides when and where events should spawn, and if an agent message should follow; and where and when the requests should be generated and sent.

        When each node has been updated, all the nodes will be iterated over again to reset these to "ready", meaning they are ready to be updated again.

      • loadNodeNetwork

        public void loadNodeNetwork(java.util.HashMap<Position,Node> nodeMap)
                     throws java.lang.IllegalArgumentException

        This method must be called with an instantiated HashMap containing the node network, before the simulation can be started. If the method is called with a null HashMap nothing will happen.

        Parameters:
        nodeMap - the HashMap containing the node network.
        Throws:
        java.lang.IllegalArgumentException

      • getNodesWithinRangeofNode

        public java.util.ArrayList<Node> getNodesWithinRangeofNode(Node nodeAtCentrum)

        This operation is somewhat expensive, and if possible should be used before the start of the simulation.

        By giving the method a node it will find all nodes within the range of the specified node, and return an ArrayList containing all of the found nodes.

        Parameters:
        nodeAtCentrum - the node whose signal strength is going to be tested and compared against other nodes.
        Returns:
        and ArrayList containing all found nodes.

      • getCurrentTime

        public int getCurrentTime()

        Returns the current time of the simulation.

        Returns:
        the current amount of elapsed updates.

      • getHasLoadedNodeNetwork

        public boolean getHasLoadedNodeNetwork()

        Returns whether or not a node network has been loaded by the field class.

        Returns:
        true if a node network has been loaded, false otherwise.

      • getRecentlyChangedNodeNetwork

        public boolean getRecentlyChangedNodeNetwork()

        Returns whether or not the node network recently has been modified.
        No use as of this version.

        Returns:
        true if the node network has been modified, false otherwise.

      • getStringRepresentation

        public java.lang.String getStringRepresentation()

        Returns a string representation of the node network. Do not confuse this with a toString method. See the getStringRepresentation method in the Node class for further details.

        Returns:
        the string representation of the node network.

      • getSimulationIsRunning

        public boolean getSimulationIsRunning()

        Returns whether or not the simulation is currently running.

        Returns:
        true if the simulation is running, false otherwise.

      • setSimulationIsRunning

        public void setSimulationIsRunning(boolean simulationIsRunning)

        Sets the simulation to run or stop. Only works as a means to start the simulation once.

        Parameters:
        simulationIsRunning - true to start, false to stop.
